div.p: Greetings in Christ to you I pray.

Father and lord to be honored by me, when I first passed through Bretten, the town of my prince, I understood that mine and the W端rttembergian were with Karl of Baden in Maulbronn, to which I went, and I presented what I had from you. However, because I understood that due to the business, which it is of great interest for you to understand, and therefore a certain faithful one from yours is to be called to us, to whom these things are to be explained, I will not write more. I am sending back the articles of pacification with the Bernese, as I promised; for your son granted our men access to them, which he took with him. I hear that the soldier, who was enlisted for the Spaniard in Augsburg, is passing through W端rzburg, Mainz, Trier, and thus into Luxembourg. May the Lord avert all evils from us.
From yours, who will be sent to us, we will understand where the soldier, who is gathered with you, is to be sent.
Cirler and Ehemus greet you. Greet your brothers and Mr. de Chum. Tomorrow we return home from here. Farewell.
To the most illustrious man Mr. Heinrich Bullinger, faithful minister of the Z端rich church. In Z端rich.
